instructions: Bring sugar and 1/2 cup water to a boil in a saucepan, stirring to dissolve sugar. Stir in dried lavender. Remove from heat. Let cool completely. Strain out lavender. Refrigerate syrup until ready to serve (up to 1 month).
Pour about 6 ounces Champagne and 1 1/2 teaspoons syrup into each flute. Garnish each with a lavender sprig.

ingredients.ingred_name: (750 mL) dry Champagne or sparkling wine, chilled

name: Ginger Sparkler
instructions: Set a fine-mesh sieve over a small bowl; set aside. In a small saucepan, boil ginger, sugar, and 1/4 cup water until syrupy, about 2 minutes. Pour through sieve into bowl, discarding solids. (To store syrup, refrigerate in an airtight container, up to 1 week.)
Pour 1 tablespoon syrup into each of 8 tall glasses. Top with sparkling wine, and gently stir.

ingredients.ingred_name: (750 ml) dry sparkling wine, such as Cava, Prosecco, or Champagne

name: Kir Royales
instructions: Just before serving, pour 1 tablespoon creme de cassis into each glass. Fill with Champagne, and garnish with zest.

ingredients.ingred_name: Champagne or other sparkling white wine

ingredients: 6 strips tangerine or orange zest, for garnish

name: Semifreddo Bellini
instructions: Blend peaches, peach schnapps, 2 tablespoons Champagne, the sugar, and ice in a blender until smooth. Divide mixture between 2 glasses; top off each glass with 1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons Champagne, and serve.

ingredients.ingred_name: peeled, chopped peaches, frozen until hardened
plus 2 tablespoons chilled Champagne or sparkling white wine

name: Blue Hawaii
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine pineapple juice, rum, vodka, lemon juice, blue Curacao, and simple syrup. Shake and strain over ice. Serve with a cherry and a pineapple wedge.
ingredients: Cherry and a pineapple wedge (for serving)

name: Rye-Whiskey Switchels
instructions: Stir together vinegar, sorghum syrup, ginger, and 2 cups water in a nonreactive container. Cover and refrigerate at least 4 hours and up to 1 day. Strain; return to container and refrigerate, covered, up to 1 week.
For each drink, fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Pour in 1 1/2 ounces each vinegar mixture and whiskey. Shake well. Strain into a chilled coupe glass; serve.

ingredients.ingred_name: finely grated peeled fresh ginger (from a 2-inch piece)

name: The Golden Ticket Mocktail
instructions: Pour pineapple juice, white rum (if using), cream of coconut, and fresh orange juice into a cocktail shaker filled with ice; shake until cold, about 10 seconds.
Divide between 2 lowball glasses filled with crushed ice, and top with seltzer. Garnish each with a pineapple leaf (if using) and serve.

ingredients.ingred_name: cream of coconut (such as Coco Lopez)

name: Cider-Bourbon Cocktail
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add cider, bourbon, lemon juice, and ginger; shake until well chilled. Strain and divide cocktail between two coupes or lowball glasses. Garnish with apple slices.
ingredients: 2 thin slices from a small apple, such as lady, for garnish

name: Shirley Tempest
instructions: Combine rum, grenadine, and 1/4 cup soda in a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake until cold. Strain into a martini glass and top with remaining 2 tablespoons soda. Garnish with cherry.

name: Lillet and Cucumber Aperitif
instructions: Fill a lowball glass with ice. Add Lillet and cucumber and serve.

name: Lemon-Gin Martini
instructions: Stir together gin, vermouth, juice, and ice in a pitcher. Pour into glasses, leaving ice in pitcher. Garnish with zest.

name: Cherry Bounce
instructions: Using the tip of a sharp knife, pierce 2 to 3 holes in each fresh cherry, then place in a large crock or jar with a tight-fitting lid. Pour in rum and stir to combine, pressing lightly on cherries to release some juices. Cover jar and let stand in a cool, dark place at least 1 week and up to 1 month.
Strain mixture, discarding solids; pour liquid into a resealable jar or bottle. Refrigerate at least 1 hour and up to 6 months. Serve chilled, over ice, with frozen cherries.

ingredients.ingred_name: fresh sour cherries, rinsed and drained (3 1/2 cups)
white rum, such as Captain Morgan

ingredients: Frozen sour cherries on the stem, for serving (optional)

name: Habanero-Hibiscus Sour
instructions: Syrup:Combine sugar, 2 habaneros, and 1/2 cup water in a small saucepan and bring to a boil, stirring until sugar has dissolved. Remove from heat. Halve remaining habanero lengthwise, and stir into syrup along with flowers. Let steep 10 minutes. Strain into a Ball jar or other heatproof container with a lid; let cool completely. Cover and refrigerate until cold. Syrup can be refrigerated up to 1 month. (Makes 1/2 cup.)

Cocktail:Fill a cocktail shaker halfway with ice. Add pisco, syrup, and lime juice. Shake vigorously 10 seconds; strain evenly into 2 chilled coupe glasses. Add egg whites to shaker. Shake vigorously until very frothy, about 20 seconds; strain evenly into glasses. Top each with a few dashes of bitters; serve immediately.
ingredients: Peychaud's or Angostura bitters, for serving

name: Cranberry Champagne Cocktail
instructions: Spoon pureed cranberry sauce into a champagne flute. Top with sparkling wine by tilting glass and slowly pouring wine down side of flute (mixture will foam as the wine reacts to the sugar in the cranberry sauce). Serve immediately.
ingredients: Sparkling dry white wine, such as prosecco, chilled

name: Celery French 75 Cocktails
instructions: Combine sugar and water in a small saucepan. Bring to a simmer over medium heat, stirring until sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat; add celery leaves. Let syrup cool. Pour through a fine sieve into a bowl; discard leaves.

To assemble each cocktail, combine 1 tablespoon celery syrup, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, and 1/2 ounce gin in a Champagne glass. Top off with wine; gently stir to combine. Garnish with celery leaf and lemon rind or twist; serve immediately.

ingredients.ingred_name: packed fresh celery leaves, plus more for garnish
(750 mL) sparkling wine, such as Champagne or cava, chilled

ingredients: Candied Lemon Zestor lemon twists, for garnish

name: Bourbon Mint Tea
instructions: In a large saucepan, boil 4 cups water. Add sugar; stir to dissolve. Remove from heat; add teabags. Steep 10 minutes; discard teabags. Add 4 cups cold water; transfer to a pitcher, and chill. Add mint leaves. Using a wooden spoon, crush mint until fragrant; stir in bourbon. Serve over ice.

name: Ginger Caipirinha
instructions: Add lime quarters, sugar, ginger, and ice to a mixing glass or cocktail shaker; muddle well.
Fill an 8-ounce glass 3/4 full with crushed ice. Add the cachaca.
Pour the muddled mixture into glass with cachaca. Stir well to make sure sugar dissolves completely. Garnish with sugar cane stick.

name: Michelada Beer Cocktail
instructions: Stir together the lime zest and salt in a small saucer.  Cut lime in half and rub cut side over the rim of 2 pint glasses. Dip the rims in the lime salt to coat.

Fill the glasses two thirds full with ice.  Squeeze the halved limes over ice and drop rinds into the glass.  Divide the tomato juice, chipotle peppers, and lager between glasses.  Stir and serve immediately.
ingredients: 1 lime, zested and cut in half

ingredients.ingred_name: minced chipotle peppers in adobo sauce

name: Pina Colada
instructions: 1. Combine all ingredients in a blender. Blend until smooth. Divide among chilled glasses, garnish with pineapple wedges and leaves, and serve immediately.

ingredients.ingred_name: fresh pineapple chunks (from 1/2 pineapple), plus wedges and leaves, for serving
(3/4 cup) cream of coconut, such as Coco Lopez

name: Rose-Petal Gin Fizz
instructions: Fill a tumbler with ice. Pour in gin and syrup, and stir. Stir in sparkling water. Garnish with rose petals, if desired.
ingredients: Pesticide-free rose petals, gently rinsed in cold water, for garnish (optional)

name: Hibiscus Margarita
instructions: Combine syrup, tequila, and lime juice; pour over ice and top with seltzer. Serve with a lime wedge and a piece of crystallized ginger.

ingredients.ingred_name: fresh lime juice, plus lime wedge for serving

name: Pimm's Cup Pitcher
instructions: In large pitcher, place strawberries, lemons, limes, and oranges. Add Pimm's, and mash down lightly with a large spoon. May be made 3 to 4 hours ahead up to this point.
Fill each glass halfway with ice. Add about 1/3 cup Pimm's mixture. Fill glass with soda; stir. Place cucumber spear in each glass; serve.

ingredients.ingred_name: (6 ounces) strawberries, hulled and cut into quarters

ingredients: 1 orange (blood orange if possible), sliced into 1-inch wedges

name: Martha's Sazerac
instructions: Place sugar cube and 2 teaspoons water in a cocktail shaker; stir to dissolve. Add bourbon and bitters, fill with ice, and stir to chill.
Pour liqueur into a rocks glass and swirl to coat; pour out excess. Strain bourbon mixture into glass. Twist lemon peel and rub around rim of glass (do not add to drink).

name: Roasted Rhubarb-and-Cherry Gimlet
instructions: Blend rhubarb-cherry mixture and syrup in a blender until smooth (you should have about 1/2 cup). Working in two batches, combine rhubarb purée, lime juice, and gin in a cocktail shaker then fill with ice. Shake until cold, about 10 seconds. Divide among 4 lowball or rocks glasses filled with ice; top with seltzer and lime wheels.

ingredients.ingred_name: fresh lime juice, plus wheels for serving

name: Citrus Dreaming (Aperol Negroni)
instructions: Stir together gin, Aperol, and sweet and dry vermouth with ice in a cocktail shaker for 8 to 12 seconds. Strain into a chilled coupe glass rinsed with absinthe. Top with a skewered orange peel and fresh cranberry.

ingredients.ingred_name: Stonecutter Spirits Single Barrel Gin (2 ounces)

ingredients: Orange peel and fresh cranberry, for topping

name: Coconut-Water Vodka Cocktail
instructions: Fill a highball glass with ice. Add vodka and coconut water; stir to combine. Garnish with an orange twist.

name: Marmalade Whiskey Sours
instructions: Combine bourbon, lime juice, sugar, marmalade, and bitters in a pitcher. Stir vigorously until sugar and marmalade are dissolved.
Fill rocks glasses with crushed ice, top with bourbon mixture, and serve each with a maraschino cherry and a drizzle of cherry liquid.
ingredients: Crushed ice and maraschino cherries in liquid, for serving

name: Mediterranean Cucumber Tonic
instructions: In a rocks glass, muddle 1 mini-cucumber slice and fresh lemon juice. Top with ice, 2 more mini-cucumber slices, Fever-Tree Mediterranean tonic water, a squeeze from one slice of lemon, and a sprig of fresh rosemary.

ingredients.ingred_name: fresh lemon juice for muddling, plus one lemon slice for squeezing

name: French Martini
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker halfway with ice. Add in vodka, Chambord, and pineapple juice. Shake well. Strain into a 4-ounce martini glass and garnish with lemon twist.

name: Three Amigos Cocktail
instructions: Fill a large pitcher with ice cubes. Stir in beer and limeade. Pour into salt-rimmed glasses.

name: Rye-Whiskey Switchels
instructions: Stir together vinegar, sorghum syrup, ginger, and 2 cups water in a nonreactive container. Cover and refrigerate at least 4 hours and up to 1 day. Strain; return to container and refrigerate, covered, up to 1 week.
For each drink, fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Pour in 1 1/2 ounces each vinegar mixture and whiskey. Shake well. Strain into a chilled coupe glass; serve.

ingredients.ingred_name: finely grated peeled fresh ginger (from a 2-inch piece)

name: Mojito
instructions: In the bottom of a highball or Collins glass, muddle mint leaves with simple syrup for a few seconds until mint starts to break down. Fill glass with ice, then add rum and lime juice; stir to combine. Top with soda water and garnish with mint sprig.
ingredients: 8 mint leaves, plus sprig for serving

name: Bitter Bee Cocktail
instructions: Honey-Cardamom Syrup:In a small saucepan, toast cardamom over medium-high heat until fragrant, 1 minute. Stir in 1/2 cup water and honey. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat; simmer 5 minutes. Let cool completely. Strain; discard solids. Refrigerate in an airtight container up to 1 week.

Cocktail:Combine tequila, grapefruit juice, 3/4 ounce syrup, and bitters in a cocktail shaker. Fill halfway with ice. Shake until outside of shaker is frosty, about 30 seconds. Strain and serve on ice, garnished with grapefruit wedge.

ingredients.ingred_name: fresh grapefruit juice, plus a wedge for serving

name: The Firecracker
instructions: Bring sugar and 3/4 cup water to a boil in a small pot. Reduce heat, and simmer, stirring, until sugar dissolves. Remove from heat, and let cool. Simple syrup can be refrigerated up to 2 weeks.
Combine syrup, cherries, and gin in a 3-quart pitcher, and refrigerate until cold, at least 2 hours and up to 6 hours. Stir in lemon juice and wine. Serve over ice, and garnish with lemon slices.

ingredients.ingred_name: fresh or thawed frozen sour cherries, pitted

name: Pear-Rosemary Vodka Cocktails
instructions: Place enough pears in a 56-ounce glass jar to fill to the top. Add vodka. Seal jar, and let stand at room temperature for at least 2 weeks. Strain vodka, and discard pears.
Heat sugar and water in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, stirring, until sugar dissolves. Add rosemary. Remove from heat, and let stand for 30 minutes. Discard rosemary. Let cool completely.
Combine vodka, rosemary simple syrup, pear nectar, and sparkling water in a large pitcher. Divide among 8 ice-filled glasses, and garnish each with a rosemary sprig. Serve immediately.
ingredients: 6 to 8 small firm pears, such as Seckel
12 sprigs fresh rosemary, plus more for garnish

name: Grilled-Peach Old-Fashioned
instructions: Quarter peaches and grill until charred. Muddle sugar, thyme, bitters, and lime juice in a cocktail shaker. Add bourbon, and divide among 4 ice-filled glasses. Garnish with peach section and thyme sprigs.
ingredients: 6 sprigs thyme, plus more for garnish

name: Strawberry Daiquiri
instructions: Combine lime zest and 2 tablespoons sugar in a food processor. Pulse until combined. Set aside.
Place lime juice, strawberries, rum, 2 to 4 tablespoons sugar, depending on the sweetness of your strawberries, and ice cubes in a blender. Blend until smooth.
Rub the rims of four glasses with a lime wedge, dip rims in lime sugar, and fill glasses with daiquiri.

ingredients.ingred_name: (1/4 cup) freshly squeezed lime juice, plus 1 tablespoon lime zest, from 2 limes
granulated sugar, plus up to 2 additional tablespoons

name: Litchi Martini
instructions: Place 2 to 3 litchis in each of two chilled 10-ounce martini glasses. Fill a 20-ounce cocktail shaker with 2 cups of ice. Add vodka, sake, and litchi syrup. Shake well, and divide between martini glasses. Serve immediately.

name: Cider-Bourbon Cocktail
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add cider, bourbon, lemon juice, and ginger; shake until well chilled. Strain and divide cocktail between two coupes or lowball glasses. Garnish with apple slices.
ingredients: 2 thin slices from a small apple, such as lady, for garnish

name: Pimm's Cup Pitcher
instructions: In large pitcher, place strawberries, lemons, limes, and oranges. Add Pimm's, and mash down lightly with a large spoon. May be made 3 to 4 hours ahead up to this point.
Fill each glass halfway with ice. Add about 1/3 cup Pimm's mixture. Fill glass with soda; stir. Place cucumber spear in each glass; serve.

ingredients.ingred_name: (6 ounces) strawberries, hulled and cut into quarters

ingredients: 1 orange (blood orange if possible), sliced into 1-inch wedges

name: Bourbon and Ginger
instructions: Divide bourbon among 4 glasses filled with ice. Divide ginger ale among glasses and squeeze 1 lime wedge into each. Serve immediately.

name: Cranberry Manhattan
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add whiskey, cranberry sauce, vermouth, and bitters. Cover and shake vigorously for 15 seconds. Strain into a chilled coupe glass or rocks glass and serve immediately.

name: Strawberry-Cucumber Gin-Elderflower Spritz
instructions: Muddle sliced strawberries, halved cucumber slices, sugar, and lemon juice in the bottom of a pitcher until fruits break down and release most of their juices and sugar has dissolved. Stir in gin and St-Germain to combine. Fill 6 glasses halfway with ice. Divide fruit-and-gin mixture evenly among glasses. Top each with 1 to 2 ounces club soda; stir once. Top each with a few dashes of bitters, whole strawberries, and cucumber rounds; serve immediately.
ingredients: 12 strawberries, hulled and sliced (1 1/4 cups), plus whole berries for serving
12 thin cucumber slices, halved (3/4 cup), plus whole rounds for serving
Club soda, chilled; and Peychaud's bitters, for serving

name: Tom Collins
instructions: Fill a Collins glass with ice. Stir in gin, lemon juice, and simple syrup. Top with seltzer. Garnish with lemon wedge.

ingredients.ingred_name: fresh lemon juice, plus 1 lemon wedge, for garnish

name: Raspberry-Herb Cocktail
instructions: Reserve 16 berries. Mash the remaining berries, the sugar, and herbs in a large glass bowl. Stir in vodka, lemon juice, and Prosecco. Pour mixture through a sieve into a pitcher, pressing through; discard solids. Serve over ice. Squeeze 2 berries into each drink. Garnish with herb sprigs.
ingredients: 6 large sprigs (about 2 ounces) fresh mint, basil, or both, plus more for garnish

name: Lemon Whiskey Sour
instructions: Rub the rim of an old fashioned glass with lemon wedge. Fill a saucer with sugar, and dip the glass, upside down, into the sugar.

Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add whiskey, lemon juice, and 1 teaspoon superfine sugar, and shake until sugar dissolves. Strain into an ice-filled old fashioned glass, and garnish with lemon slice and a cherry.

ingredients.ingred_name: superfine sugar, plus more for rim

name: Lillet-Basil Cocktail
instructions: Put ice, Lillet, gin, orange juice, and basil in a cocktail shaker; shake well. Fill a glass with ice; strain mixture into glass. Add tonic water. Garnish with cucumber spear, cinnamon stick, and basil sprigs.

ingredients.ingred_name: loosely packed fresh basil leaves, plus sprigs for garnish

name: Classic Martinis
instructions: Shake or stir 1/2 cup vodka or gin and 1 1/2 teaspoons vermouth in an ice-filled shaker. Strain into a chilled martini glass and garnish with olives, caper berries, or onions. Repeat with remaining vodka or gin and vermouth.
ingredients: Cocktail olives, caper berries, or cocktail onions, for garnish

name: Chile-Citrus Margarita
instructions: Run a lime wedge around the edge of glass, and dip into a shallow dish filled with coarse salt to coat rim. Add tequila, triple sec, agave, lime juice, and orange juice to a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well, and pour into prepared glass, and garnish with lime wedge.

ingredients.ingred_name: lime juice, plus lime wedge for garnish

name: Aperol Spritz
instructions: Fill an old-fashioned glass with ice. Add Aperol, Prosecco, and soda water to fill. Garnish with orange slice.

name: Green Apple Martini
instructions: Bring sugar, 1 cup water, and 3/4 of the apple peel to a boil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. (Reserve the remaining apple peel for garnish.) Cook, stirring occasionally, until sugar has dissolved, about 5 minutes. Transfer syrup to a medium bowl set over an ice bath; let stand, stirring occasionally, until cool. Pour through a fine sieve into another bowl; discard solids.
Cut apple into chunks; press through an electric juicer into a small bowl. Pour through a fine sieve into another bowl; discard any solids, and set juice aside
Cut remaining peel into thin, 4-inch-long strips. Tie each strip into a knot; set aside in a bowl of water with lemon juice.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add vodka, 2 ounces syrup, and 1/3 cup apple juice; shake. Divide between 2 martini glasses; garnish with apple knots.
ingredients: 1 medium green apple (about 8 ounces), peeled (peels reserved)

name: Cranberry Sparkler
instructions: Place blackberry puree and cranberry juice in a champagne flute. Add sparkling water to fill. Garnish with mint.

name: Big-Batch Lemon-Mint Julep
instructions: Squeeze 16 of the lemons, reserving the rinds and juice. In a large saucepan, combine 3 cups of the sugar and 3 cups water, stirring until dissolved. Add the lemon rinds, and cook over medium heat until the liquid becomes syrupy, about 15 minutes. Remove from heat, and let stand until room temperature. Remove, and discard lemon rinds. Stir in the lemon juice, about 4 cups.

Spread remaining 1/2 cup sugar on a small plate. Cut the remaining lemon into quarters. Rub the wedges along the rims of 16 mint-julep cups or tall glasses, and invert the glasses in the sugar to create a sugared rim.

Crush a few mint leaves into the bottom of each glass with a muddler or the back of a wooden spoon. Fill each glass with ice cubes, and pour 1/2 cup of lemon syrup in each glass. Top off with about 1 1/2 ounces of bourbon per glass. Garnish each glass with a fresh sprig of mint.

name: Champagne Cocktail
instructions: Soak sugar cube in several drops of Angostura Bitters. Place sugar cube in the bottom of a fluted glass and fill with champagne. Stir with a bar spoon to dissolve sugar and agitate the carbonation.

name: Sgroppino
instructions: Place all ingredients in large bowl; whisk to combine. Using a ladle, transfer to a serving pitcher. To serve, pour into champagne flutes and squeeze lemon twist over cocktail before adding to glass.

name: Mandarin Cocktail
instructions: Pour liqueur into a champagne flute; top with champagne. Twist clementine peel over glass and gently drop into cocktail.

ingredients.ingred_name: mandarin liqueur, such as Mandarine Napolean

name: Pomegranate-Honey Coolers
instructions: Combine white wine and pomegranate juice in a pitcher. Add honey, and stir until dissolved. Divide among 6 ice-filled glasses. Garnish with slices of lemon.

ingredients.ingred_name: (750 milliliters) dry white wine, such as Sauvignon Blanc

name: Halloween Bloody Mary Shooters
instructions: Bloody Mary Mix: Pulse celery in a food processor until finely chopped. Add 2 cups tomato juice and puree until smooth. Transfer to a pitcher and stir in remaining 4 cups tomato juice, lemon juice, horseradish, Worcestershire, celery salt, hot sauce, and pepper. Cover and refrigerate at least 12 hours and up to 2 days.
Shooters: Stir together equal parts salt and pepper on a small plate. Rub lemon wedge around the rims of two double shot (3-ounce) glasses. Dip rims into salt and pepper mixture.

Pour 2 ounces Bloody Mary mix into bottom of each glass (reserve remaining Bloody Mary mix for another use). Holding a spoon upside down over the top of the glass, slowly pour 1 ounce vodka over spoon into each glass (vodka should sit on top of Bloody Mary mix and create a layer of black). Garnish with celery.

ingredients.ingred_name: lightly packed grated peeled fresh horseradish

ingredients: Black lava salt and coarsely ground black pepper, for rim

name: Creepy Cherry Cocktail
instructions: Place 1 cup ice, gin, creme de violette, lemon juice, and maraschino liqueur in a cocktail shaker. Shake 30 seconds. Place cocktail cherry in the bottom of a martini glass. Strain gin mixture into glass, then top with Campari.

name: Extra Dark and Stormy
instructions: Combine ginger and sugar in a highball glass and muddle. Add lime juice and crushed ice; top with rum and amaro and stir.
Peel off a long strip of zest from orange. Using tongs, wave it over a gas flame or a lit match. Roll orange strip so it resembles a rosebud; skewer and serve with cocktail.

name: Black Lagoon Cocktail
instructions: Combine vodka, syrup, and juice in a cocktail shaker, stir to combine. Add seltzer, and divide between two glasses filled with licorice ice cubes. Serve immediately.

name: Cranberry Champagne Cocktail
instructions: Spoon pureed cranberry sauce into a champagne flute. Top with sparkling wine by tilting glass and slowly pouring wine down side of flute (mixture will foam as the wine reacts to the sugar in the cranberry sauce). Serve immediately.
ingredients: Sparkling dry white wine, such as prosecco, chilled

name: Iced Margaritas
instructions: Pour the salt onto a small plate. Rub the outside rim of each glass with the cut lime. Dip each glass into the reserved salt; set aside.

Place lime juice, lemon juice, triple sec, and 3 cups ice in a blender, and puree on low speed until completely blended. Add tequila and blend for 2 seconds. Pour margaritas into the reserved glasses, over ice, and serve immediately.

ingredients.ingred_name: (about 4 limes) freshly squeezed lime juice, plus 1 lime cut in half for the glasses

name: The Negroni
instructions: Pour all ingredients into an ice-filled mixing glass. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass. (Alternatively, combine ingredients in a tumbler and serve in the same glass.) Garnish with an orange twist.

name: St-Germain, Gin, and Plum Cocktail
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add St-Germain and gin and shake vigorously. Strain into a glass, add plum slices, and serve.

name: Cranberry Martini
instructions: Rub the rims of 2 martini glasses with a lime wedge, and then dip each rim into a saucer of red sanding sugar, rotating gently to evenly coat. Chill in freezer at least 10 minutes. In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, shake vodka, cranberry juice, and vermouth until chilled, about 20 seconds. Strain into chilled glasses, and garnish with skewered fresh cranberries.

name: Blackberry-Plum Mojitos
instructions: Bring sugar and 1 1/4 cups water to a boil in a small saucepan, stirring until sugar is dissolved, 3 minutes. Remove from heat; let cool 15 minutes. Syrup can be refrigerated for up to 1 month.
Combine lemon juice, fruit, and basil in a bowl. Add syrup; mash lightly to release juices. Refrigerate at least 1 day and up to 4 days.
Combine fruit mixture and vodka in a pitcher or punch bowl; ladle about 1/3 cup into each glass. Fill with ice. Top with sparkling water, garnish with more basil, and serve.

ingredients.ingred_name: plums, pitted and cut into wedges
fresh basil leaves, plus more for serving

name: Chartreuse Martini
instructions: Place ice in a cocktail shaker. Add Chartreuse, dry vermouth and gin. Shake vigorously and strain into 2 coupe or martini glasses.

name: The Hotelier
instructions: Gently stir together liquids in an ice-filled cocktail shaker, then strain into a double old-fashioned glass filled with fresh ice. Twist lemon rind over drink to express its oil, then use the peel as a garnish.

ingredients.ingred_name: Leopold Brothers New York Sour Apple Liqueur

ingredients: 1 piece lemon rind, 3/4 inch wide and 2 1/2 inches long

name: Sidecar
instructions: Place sugar in a saucer. Moisten the rim of a martini glass using a lime wedge. Dip rim in sugar; repeat with second glass. Set aside.

In a cocktail shaker, stir together sugar and water until sugar is dissolved. Stir in brandy, Cointreau, and lime juice. Fill with ice cubes, and shake well. Strain into prepared glasses, and serve with a lime twist.
ingredients: Juice of 4 limes, plus 2 wedges for glasses and twists for garnish

name: Meyer Lemon-Orange Bitters
instructions: Heat oven to 200 degrees. Using a vegetable peeler, peel citrus to make strips of zest, being careful not to remove pith. Arrange in a single layer on a parchment-lined baking sheet and bake until dry, about 1 hour. Let cool.
Transfer zest to a 1-quart glass jar and top with remaining ingredients. Cover tightly and store in a cool, dark place for three weeks, shaking jar once a day.
Pour liquid through a fine mesh strainer or paper coffee filter and into a clean jar. Add citrus zest and discard aromatics.

ingredients.ingred_name: good-quality vodka, such as Prairie Organic

name: Plum Negroni
instructions: Using a muddling tool or wooden spoon, crush plums and sugar in an 8-ounce glass. Stir in gin and Aperol until sugar is dissolved. Fill with ice; stir in seltzer. Add orange twists and whole plum; serve.
ingredients: 2 cherry plums, halved and pitted, or 1/2 small black plum, cut into wedges, plus 1 whole plum (or more wedges) for serving

name: Adonis Punch
instructions: Stir together gin, pomegranate juice and simple syrup in a punch bowl or large pitcher. Add ice cubes and sparkling rose just before serving.

name: Rye-Whiskey Switchels
instructions: Stir together vinegar, sorghum syrup, ginger, and 2 cups water in a nonreactive container. Cover and refrigerate at least 4 hours and up to 1 day. Strain; return to container and refrigerate, covered, up to 1 week.
For each drink, fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Pour in 1 1/2 ounces each vinegar mixture and whiskey. Shake well. Strain into a chilled coupe glass; serve.

ingredients.ingred_name: finely grated peeled fresh ginger (from a 2-inch piece)

name: Healthier Pina Colada
instructions: Puree pineapple, coconut water, ice, sugar, and lemon juice in a blender. Stir in rum. Garnish glasses with coconut.

name: Hot Buttered Rum
instructions: Beat butter, sugar, orange zest, cinnamon, ginger, and nutmegwith a mixer on medium speed until combined, about1 minute.

Combine 2 tablespoons spiced butter with 1 1/2 ounces(3 tablespoons) dark rum in each of 4 heatproof glasses. Pour3/4 cup boiling water over each, and stir. Top each with asqueeze of fresh orange juice.

name: Pomegranate-Honey Coolers
instructions: Combine white wine and pomegranate juice in a pitcher. Add honey, and stir until dissolved. Divide among 6 ice-filled glasses. Garnish with slices of lemon.

ingredients.ingred_name: (750 milliliters) dry white wine, such as Sauvignon Blanc

name: Campari, Gin, and Orange
instructions: Shake gin, Campari, andClement Creole Shrubb in anice-filled cocktail shaker.Strain into 2 martini glasses.Garnish each with a twist.

name: Lemon-Gin Martini
instructions: Stir together gin, vermouth, juice, and ice in a pitcher. Pour into glasses, leaving ice in pitcher. Garnish with zest.

name: Cilantro Negroni
instructions: Muddle cilantro sprigs with sugar and orange wedge in a glass. Add Campari and ice. Add club soda. Stir.

name: Pernod-Bourbon Spritz
instructions: Place 1 large ice cube in a rocks glass or fill halfway with ice. Add Pernod, bourbon, bitters, and soda. Stir once and garnish with lemon twist; serve immediately.

name: Orange Wheat Shandy
instructions: Combine beer, orange juice, and almond extract in a pitcher. Stir; serve with sliced oranges.

ingredients.ingred_name: freshly squeezed orange juice (from 3 to 4 oranges)

name: Ginger Caipirinha
instructions: Add lime quarters, sugar, ginger, and ice to a mixing glass or cocktail shaker; muddle well.
Fill an 8-ounce glass 3/4 full with crushed ice. Add the cachaca.
Pour the muddled mixture into glass with cachaca. Stir well to make sure sugar dissolves completely. Garnish with sugar cane stick.

name: Rose Grapefruit Cocktail
instructions: Divide wine and juice among four glasses. Fill glasses with ice and stir.

ingredients.ingred_name: fresh pink or Ruby Red grapefruit juice

name: Amaretto Cocktails
instructions: In a pitcher, combine amaretto and rum; add club soda to taste. Serve over ice, garnished with a cherry.
ingredients: 8 brandied or maraschino cherries, for garnish

name: Sherry with Olives
instructions: Pour sherry into 6 small glasses; add 2 or 3 olives to each.

ingredients.ingred_name: (750 milliliters) dry sherry, such as fino or manzanilla, chilled
(5 ounces) Spanish olives, pitted (plain or stuffed with pimientos, almonds, or garlic)

name: Make-Your-Own Margaritas
instructions: Pour tequila, triple sec, and lime juice into a cocktail shaker filled with ice.
Shake well. Dip glass in salt if desired, and fill with ice. Strain drink into glass.
ingredients: Ice cubes and salt (optional), for serving

name: Victory Garden Cocktail
instructions: Thyme-Rosemary Syrup: In a saucepan, combine sugar, thyme, rosemary, and 3/4 cup water. Bring to a boil, stirring, until sugar dissolves. Remove from heat; let cool completely. Strain, discarding herbs. Refrigerate syrup in an airtight container at least 1 hour and up to 1 month. (Makes about 3/4 cup.)

Cocktail: Fill a cocktail shaker halfway with ice. Add whiskey, 1 1/2 ounces syrup, brandy, lemon juice, and bitters. Cover; shake vigorously 10 to 12 seconds. Strain into two rocks glasses filled halfway with ice. Top each with club soda. Wave rosemary over an open flame, such as a gas burner or kitchen torch, just until fragrant and charred in places, about 15 seconds. Garnish glasses with rosemary; serve immediately.

ingredients.ingred_name: whiskey, such as Stonecutter Spirits heritage cask whiskey

name: Cranberry Sparkler
instructions: Place blackberry puree and cranberry juice in a champagne flute. Add sparkling water to fill. Garnish with mint.

name: Cranberry Manhattan
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add whiskey, cranberry sauce, vermouth, and bitters. Cover and shake vigorously for 15 seconds. Strain into a chilled coupe glass or rocks glass and serve immediately.

name: Sour-Cherry Cordials
instructions: Bring cherries, sugar, wine, lemon juice, and salt to a gentle simmer over medium-low heat, stirring to dissolve sugar. Cook for 4 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, transfer cherries to a bowl. Raise heat to medium-high, and cook until mixture is syrupy, about 5 minutes. Let cool completely. Return cherries to syrup. (Cherries in syrup can be refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 1 month.)

Fill 8 glasses with ice. Pour 2 tablespoons gin and 2 tablespoons syrup into each glass, and add 5 cherries. Divide seltzer among glasses (1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons each). Garnish with fresh cherries and lemon zest strips, if desired. Serve immediately.

ingredients.ingred_name: fresh or thawed frozen sour cherries, pitted (about 3 cups), plus more for garnish (optional)

name: Ruby Red Tequila Cocktails
instructions: In a pitcher, combine tequila, grapefruit juice, and fresh lime juice. To serve, divide among four glasses filled with ice.

name: Kir Royales
instructions: Just before serving, pour 1 tablespoon creme de cassis into each glass. Fill with Champagne, and garnish with zest.

ingredients.ingred_name: Champagne or other sparkling white wine

ingredients: 6 strips tangerine or orange zest, for garnish

name: Sparkling Wine Sangria
instructions: In a pitcher (at least 2 quarts) combine fruit and peach brandy. Stir and refrigerate for at least one hour. Add nectar and Prosecco. Stir and serve in a five- or six-ounce juice glass (also called a Delmonico glass). Be sure to include the infused fruit in each serving.
ingredients: 1 peach, pitted and cut into wedges
1 nectarine, pitted and cut into wedges
3 apricots, pitted and cut into wedges

name: Daiquiri
instructions: Combine ice, lime juice, rum, and sugar in a blender and blend at high speed until mixture is frothy. Pour into a coupe glass; serve, garnished with lime wheel.

ingredients.ingred_name: fresh lime juice, plus thinly sliced lime wheel for serving

name: Sunny Mary
instructions: Puree tomatoes in a food processor until smooth. Strain in a cheesecloth-lined fine sieve set over a bowl, then press on solids to extract juice. (You'll need at least 2 cups.) Refrigerate until chilled, about 2 hours.
Stir together tomato juice, vodka, pickling liquid, and lemon juice. Divide among 4 ice-filled glasses, and garnish each with a peperoncino.

name: Boozy Frozen Lemonade
instructions: Combine sugar, 8 sprigs tarragon, and 3/4 cup water in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring until sugar dissolves. Remove from heat; let cool completely.
Remove and discard tarragon. Pour syrup into a freezer-safe 9-by-13-inch baking dish. Stir in lemon juice and 2 cups cold water. Freeze until solid, at least 6 hours and up to 1 day.

Remove from freezer; scrape surface of mixture with the tines of a fork until flaky. (If too firm to scrape, let stand at room temperature 10 minutes.) Transfer to a blender with gin and 2 cups ice-cold water. Blend until smooth. (Mixture can be returned to freezer at this point until ready to serve.) Divide among chilled serving glasses, garnish with tarragon sprigs and lemon wedges, and serve immediately.

ingredients.ingred_name: fresh lemon juice (from 7 to 8 lemons), plus wedges for serving

name: Coffee Coquito
instructions: Add coconut milk, evaporated milk, condensed milk, rum, and cinnamon to a blender. Blend until combined. For each drink, pour 1 1/2 ounces espresso over ice, and top with 6 ounces coconut-milk mixture. Garnish with a sprinkle of nutmeg.

name: Aperol Jasmine Spritz
instructions: Syrup: In a saucepan, combine sugar, lemon zest, and 1 cup water. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring until sugar has dissolved. Remove from heat; let cool completely. Strain, discarding zest; stir in lemon juice. Cover and refrigerate in an airtight container until cold, at least 1 hour and up to 2 weeks. Makes 2 cups.
Spritz:  In a pitcher, stir together syrup, gin, Aperol, and bitters. Top with seltzer, add rosemary and lemon zest, and stir once to combine. Pour into glasses with frozen lemon wedges; serve.

ingredients.ingred_name: aromatic bitters, such as Peychaud's or Angostura (optional)

ingredients: Rosemary sprigs and peeled lemon zest, for serving
Frozen lemon wedges or ice, for serving

name: Frozen Margaritas
instructions: Puree ice, tequila, lime juice, and simple syrup in a blender until smooth. Pour salt onto a saucer, and moisten the rims of 4 glasses with lime wedge. Dip each glass into salt, and fill with margaritas. Serve with lime wedges.
ingredients: 1 lime wedge, plus more for serving

name: The Golden Ticket Mocktail
instructions: Pour pineapple juice, white rum (if using), cream of coconut, and fresh orange juice into a cocktail shaker filled with ice; shake until cold, about 10 seconds.
Divide between 2 lowball glasses filled with crushed ice, and top with seltzer. Garnish each with a pineapple leaf (if using) and serve.

ingredients.ingred_name: cream of coconut (such as Coco Lopez)

name: Raspberry-Lime Gin and Tonic
instructions: Place a small fine strainer over a highball glass. Press raspberries through the strainer into glass; discard solids. Add truvia and lime juice; stir to dissolve. Add ice cubes to glass. Add gin and tonic water; stir to combine. Serve garnished with a lime wedge.

name: Black Lagoon Cocktail
instructions: Combine vodka, syrup, and juice in a cocktail shaker, stir to combine. Add seltzer, and divide between two glasses filled with licorice ice cubes. Serve immediately.

name: Screwed-Up Screwdriver
instructions: Place ice in a tall glass. Pour juice into glass. Pour vodka over the back of a cock-tail spoon into glass so it sits on top of juice and creates a layer of black. Slice 1/4 inch off each end of licorice, and use as a straw. Serve immediately.

name: Grilled-Peach Old-Fashioned
instructions: Quarter peaches and grill until charred. Muddle sugar, thyme, bitters, and lime juice in a cocktail shaker. Add bourbon, and divide among 4 ice-filled glasses. Garnish with peach section and thyme sprigs.
ingredients: 6 sprigs thyme, plus more for garnish

name: Blackberry Crush
instructions: In a glass, combine blackberries, lemon juice, and simple syrup; lightly crush berries to release their juice. Add ice and vodka; top with seltzer. Stir to combine. Garnish with a mint sprig.

name: Cider-Bourbon Cocktail
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add cider, bourbon, lemon juice, and ginger; shake until well chilled. Strain and divide cocktail between two coupes or lowball glasses. Garnish with apple slices.
ingredients: 2 thin slices from a small apple, such as lady, for garnish

name: Smoky Serrano-Mint Margarita
instructions: Place chile directly over a gas flame, or in a dry cast-iron skillet preheated over high and cook, turning a few times, until blackened all over, 3 to 4 minutes. Transfer to a cutting board; let cool completely. Rub a lime wheel around the rims of 2 rocks glasses. Combine salt and sumac on a small plate.

Dip rims of glasses into salt mixture to coat. Halve chile lengthwise; remove stem, ribs, and seeds. Divide chile, sugar, and mint leaves evenly between 2 glasses; gently pound with a muddling stick or the handle end of a thick wooden spoon until sugar dissolves and chile breaks down into tiny pieces. Fill glasses halfway with ice. Divide tequila, liqueur, and lime juice evenly between glasses; stir to combine. Garnish each with a mint sprig and lime wheel, and serve immediately.

ingredients.ingred_name: fresh lime juice, plus wheels for rims and for serving
pink salt or flaky sea salt (optional)
packed fresh mint leaves, plus sprigs for serving
orange liqueur, such as Cointreau or Grand Marnier

name: Spiced Pineapple Cocktail
instructions: Stir together lime juice and agave nectar; add to a blender, along with pineapple juice, pineapple, triple sec, tequila, and ice. Blend until smooth and frothy.

In a small shallow bowl or saucer, combine chili powder, sugar, and salt. Rub a lime wedge around the rims of 4 glasses, then dip glasses in spice mix to coat. Divide drink among glasses and serve with lime wedges.

ingredients.ingred_name: fresh lime juice (from about 3 limes), plus wedges for serving

name: Cucumber Cooler
instructions: In a blender, puree cucumbers and water. Pour through a fine-mesh sieve set over a large bowl, pressing on solids (you should have about 2 cups juice; refrigerate overnight, if desired). In a pitcher, mash fresh mint leaves with back of a wooden spoon until bruised. Add cucumber juice, lime, club soda, and agave nectar or honey; stir to combine. Fill 4 glasses with ice, top with drink, and serve with thinly sliced cucumber.
ingredients: 3 cucumbers, peeled, seeded, and coarsely chopped (6 cups)

name: Texas Margarita
instructions: Pour salt into a saucer. Moisten the rim of a margarita glass with a lime wedge. Dip glass into salt and fill with ice; set aside.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice and add tequila, triple sec, orange juice, and lime juice; shake to combine and strain into prepared glass. Garnish with lime and orange half moons. Serve.

ingredients.ingred_name: fresh lime juice, plus a lime wedge for the rim and a thinly sliced half moon of lime for serving
fresh orange juice, plus a thinly sliced half moon of orange for serving

name: Watermelon-Cucumber Cooler
instructions: Set a large fine-mesh sieve over a large bowl or pitcher. In a food processor or blender, puree watermelon. Pour watermelon puree through sieve, pressing on solids with a rubber spatula (you should have about 2 cups juice). Puree English cucumber and pour through sieve into watermelon juice.

In a small bowl or measuring cup, stir together lime juice and honey. Add to watermelon and cucumber juices, along with vodka. Adjust sweetness with more honey if desired. To serve, fill four glasses with ice and top each with cocktail. Garnish with cucumber slices.
ingredients: 1 large English cucumber, peeled and cut into chunks

name: Champagne-And-Orange Granita Cocktail
instructions: Combine orange juice and sugar, and stir until sugar dissolves. Transfer to an 8-inch square baking dish. Freeze, scraping around sides and breaking any lumps with a fork every 30 minutes, until evenly frozen, 2 1/2 to 3 hours. Cover with plastic wrap. Granita can be made 1 day ahead and kept in freezer until ready to serve.
Spoon 1/2 cup granita into each of 12 glasses, and add 1/2 teaspoon liqueur. Top off with Champagne.

name: Honey-Vanilla Spritzer
instructions: Bring honey, water, and vanilla bean to a simmer in a saucepan. Cook, stirring, until honey dissolves. Let cool completely. Strain through a fine sieve (there will be some seeds). Stir in lime juice. Divide among 4 ice-filled glasses. Top with seltzer.

name: Pimm's Cup with Ginger Ale
instructions: Fill a large pitcher with ice cubes. Stir in lemonade, ginger ale, Pimm's No. 1, and gin. Garnish with lemon slices.

name: Blood Orange Champagne Cocktails
instructions: Pour 3 tablespoons juice in each champagne flute. Fill flutes with champagne, and serve.

ingredients.ingred_name: freshly squeezed or frozen blood-orange juice

name: Blue Hawaii
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine pineapple juice, rum, vodka, lemon juice, blue Curacao, and simple syrup. Shake and strain over ice. Serve with a cherry and a pineapple wedge.
ingredients: Cherry and a pineapple wedge (for serving)

name: Mulled Cranberry Cocktail
instructions: In a medium saucepan, combine the juice, cinnamon stick, and cloves and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer.

Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, combine the cranberries, sugar, ground cinnamon, and 2 tablespoons of water and heat over medium-low heat, gently stirring, until the cranberries pop and are well coated with the sugar mixture.
When cool enough to handle, thread 3 to 4 berries each on 4 decorative toothpicks or skewers. Pour the mulled cranberry juice into 4 mugs and garnish with the cranberry swizzle.

name: Bourbon Hot Toddy
instructions: Bring 2 cups water to a boil in a small saucepan or tea kettle. Remove from heat and divide between two mugs. Divide bourbon, honey, lemon juice, cinnamon sticks, and cloves between mugs. Let stand 5 minutes, then stir and serve, garnished with lemon rounds.

ingredients.ingred_name: fresh lemon juice, plus 2 thinly sliced lemon rounds for serving

name: Moscow Mule
instructions: Fill a 12-ounce glass, preferably a copper mug, with crushed ice. Stir in vodka, lime juice, and ginger beer. Garnish with lime rounds.

ingredients.ingred_name: fresh lime juice, plus 3 thinly sliced lime rounds, for garnish

name: Mint, Cucumber, and Vodka Cocktails
instructions: Cut 4 thin spears from 1 cucumber, and reserve for garnish. Peel remaining cucumbers, and quarter them lengthwise. Scrape out seeds with a spoon, and discard. Coarsely chop cucumbers, then puree in a food processor until smooth. Strain through a fine sieve, pressing on solids to extract as much liquid as possible.

Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add mint, sugar, and lime juice, and shake. Add 3/4 cup cucumber juice, the vodka, and Cointreau, and shake. Strain into 4 glasses filled with ice. Garnish each cocktail with a cucumber spear.

name: Peach-and-Mint Frappes
instructions: Puree vodka, agave, peaches, and nectar with 1 cup crushed ice (or small ice cubes) in a blender, adding cold water a few tablespoons at a time, until thick and smooth. Add mint leaves; puree just until finely chopped. Serve with peach slices and mint sprigs.

ingredients.ingred_name: ripe peaches, sliced and frozen, plus more for serving
packed mint leaves, plus sprigs for serving

name: Martini
instructions: In a cocktail shaker half full of ice cubes, combine gin or vodka and vermouth. Shake well and strain into martini glasses. Garnish with olives and serve.

name: Lemon Mezcal Margarita
instructions: Mix equal parts salt and pepper on a plate. Run a wedge of lemon around the rim of two rocks glasses; dip into salt and pepper mixture. Place mezcal, triple sec, and lemon juice in a cocktail shaker filled halfway with ice; shake until outside is cold and frosty, about 30 seconds. Strain over ice into prepared glasses; serve immediately with lemon wedges.

ingredients.ingred_name: fresh lemon juice, plus wedges for serving

ingredients: Flaky sea salt and freshly ground black pepper

name: Apple Spritzers
instructions: In a pitcher, combine club soda, apple juice or cider, and Angostura bitters. Serve over ice, garnished with mint sprigs if desired.

name: Manhattan
instructions: Fill a mixing glass with ice. Add rye or bourbon, vermouth, and bitters. Stir until chilled; strain into a cocktail or martini glass. Garnish with cherry.

name: Smoky Lemon Margarita
instructions: Syrup: In a saucepan, combine sugar, lemon zest, and 1 cup water. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring until sugar has dissolved. Remove from heat; let cool completely. Strain, discarding zest; stir in lemon juice. Cover and refrigerate in an airtight container until cold, at least 1 hour and up to 2 weeks. Makes 2 cups.

Margarita: In a pitcher, stir together syrup, mezcal, and liqueur. Cover and refrigerate up to 1 day, if desired. Run an orange round along the rim of each serving glass; dip each rim in salt. Add orange rounds and frozen lemon wedges to pitcher. Pour drinks into prepared glasses; serve with more orange rounds and frozen lemon wedges.

ingredients.ingred_name: orange liqueur, such as Cointreau, chilled

ingredients: Orange rounds, coarse sea salt or margarita salt, and frozen lemon wedges (or ice) for serving

name: Litchi Martini
instructions: Place 2 to 3 litchis in each of two chilled 10-ounce martini glasses. Fill a 20-ounce cocktail shaker with 2 cups of ice. Add vodka, sake, and litchi syrup. Shake well, and divide between martini glasses. Serve immediately.

name: Vodka-Mocha Cocktail
instructions: Combine chocolate and sugar in a cocktail shaker. Pour espresso shot over chocolate mixture; stir until smooth. Add vodka and a few ice cubes. Shake vigorously several times, then strain into a chilled martini glass. Spoon over top a few tablespoons of heavy cream that's been whipped just until silky and thick; stir with a toothpick to create streaks. Serve immediately.

name: Lavender Champagne
instructions: Bring sugar and 1/2 cup water to a boil in a saucepan, stirring to dissolve sugar. Stir in dried lavender. Remove from heat. Let cool completely. Strain out lavender. Refrigerate syrup until ready to serve (up to 1 month).
Pour about 6 ounces Champagne and 1 1/2 teaspoons syrup into each flute. Garnish each with a lavender sprig.

ingredients.ingred_name: (750 mL) dry Champagne or sparkling wine, chilled

name: Lillet-Basil Cocktail
instructions: Put ice, Lillet, gin, orange juice, and basil in a cocktail shaker; shake well. Fill a glass with ice; strain mixture into glass. Add tonic water. Garnish with cucumber spear, cinnamon stick, and basil sprigs.

ingredients.ingred_name: loosely packed fresh basil leaves, plus sprigs for garnish

name: Mango Mojito
instructions: Working in batches, puree mango, rum, lime juice, and sugar in a blender until smooth. Add mint leaves and blend just until mint is finely chopped. Stir in club soda. Serve over ice. Garnish with mango slices.

ingredients.ingred_name: chopped fresh mango, plus 10 thin, peel-on slices for garnish (from 4 mangoes)

name: Rosemary Vodka Tonics
instructions: Combine vodka, Chartreuse, and simple syrup. Divide between 2 ice-filled glasses. Top off each with 2 ounces tonic water. Garnish with rosemary.

name: Cranberry Margarita
instructions: Make the Whole-Berry Cranberry Simple Syrup: Stir together sugar, cranberries, lime zest and 2 tablespoons water in a small saucepan. Refrigerate, covered, until cold, at least 1 hour and up to 1 week.

Make the cocktail: In a blender, combine tequila, lime juice, 4 cups ice, and 1 1/2 cups cranberries and syrup from Whole Berry Cranberry Simple Syrup. Blend until smooth. Divide among 4 margarita glasses.

name: Mulled Cranberry Cocktail
instructions: In a medium saucepan, combine the juice, cinnamon stick, and cloves and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer.

name: Extra Dark and Stormy
instructions: Combine ginger and sugar in a highball glass and muddle. Add lime juice and crushed ice; top with rum and amaro and stir.
Peel off a long strip of zest from orange. Using tongs, wave it over a gas flame or a lit match. Roll orange strip so it resembles a rosebud; skewer and serve with cocktail.

name: Dark and Stormy
instructions: Fill a glass with ice; add rum and ginger beer. Stir to combine and serve immediately.

name: Classic Martinis
instructions: Shake or stir 1/2 cup vodka or gin and 1 1/2 teaspoons vermouth in an ice-filled shaker. Strain into a chilled martini glass and garnish with olives, caper berries, or onions. Repeat with remaining vodka or gin and vermouth.
ingredients: Cocktail olives, caper berries, or cocktail onions, for garnish

name: Semifreddo Bellini

plus 2 tablespoons chilled Champagne or sparkling white wine

name: Basil Gimlet Fizz
instructions: Cut watermelon into 1-inch cubes, and freeze in a single layer for at least 1 hour. Muddle basil leaves with sugar in the bottom of a glass; stir in lime juice and vodka. Add watermelon cubes. Top with seltzer; garnish with basil.

name: Grapefruit-Sanbitter Spritz

name: Pina Colada

(3/4 cup) cream of coconut, such as Coco Lopez

name: Watermelon Mojitos
instructions: In a blender, in batches, puree watermelon. Pour through a fine-mesh sieve into a liquid-measuring cup, pressing on solids to extract as much liquid as possible (about 3 cups); discard solids.

In a large container, combine mint, sugar, and lime. With the back of a wooden spoon, crush mint and lime until sugar is dissolved. Add watermelon juice and rum, fill container with ice, and stir to combine. Serve over more ice with mint sprigs.
ingredients: 1/2 small seedless watermelon, cut into chunks
1 bunch mint, tough stems removed, 6 sprigs reserved for serving

name: Aperol Spritz
instructions: Fill an old-fashioned glass with ice. Add Aperol, Prosecco, and soda water to fill. Garnish with orange slice.

Serve over ice, in tall glasses garnished with mint sprigs.

ingredients.ingred_name: Bacardi 151 or other high-proof golden rum

name: Mai Tai
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine rum, lime juice, amaretto, triple sec, and simple syrup. Shake and strain over ice.

name: Tangerine-Rum Sidecar

name: Kingston Negroni
instructions: Place egg white in a shaker (with no ice); shake vigorously 30 seconds. Fill with ice, rum, Campari, and vermouth. Shake 30 seconds more. Strain into a glass filled with crushed ice; serve, with lime slice.

name: Painkiller
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine pineapple juice, rum, cream of coconut, and orange juice. Shake and strain over ice. Sprinkle with nutmeg.

name: Kir Royale
instructions: Pour creme de cassis into a Champagne flute. Top with Champagne.

name: Blackberry-Mint Julep
instructions: Roughly chop mint leaves.
Puree the mint, blackberries, and sugar in a blender. Press through a fine sieve into a bowl; discard seeds.
Rinse blender, then return puree to blender, and add bourbon and small ice cubes; blend until smooth. Divide mixture among 4 glasses. Garnish each with a mint sprig.

name: Pineapple Express
instructions: In a food processor, pulse pineapple, ginger, coconut water, coconut oil, and honey until pureed. Pour into a 9-by-13-inch baking dish and freeze until completely set, about 12 hours. Scrape granita with the tines of a fork to break apart. For each drink, place 1 cup granita in an 8-ounce glass; pour 1/4 cup white rum on top. Garnish with a strip of pineapple core and serve.

name: Pear Aperol Spritz
instructions: Fill a glass with crushed ice. Pour in Aperol, pear cider, and lemon juice. Stir, top with seltzer, and garnish with pear slice. Serve immediately.

ingredients: Seltzer and slice of pear (such as Bartlett), for serving

name: Coconut Margarita
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. On a rimmed baking sheet, toss coconut with the salt. Spread on sheet; toast in oven, stirring frequently, until golden brown, 8 to 10 minutes. Let cool, then crush with your hands until crumbly.
Pour 2 tablespoons lime juice into a shallow dish. Place coconut mixture in another dish. Dip rims of two cocktail glasses in lime juice, then in coconut mixture, coating well.
Combine remaining ingredients with 1 cup ice in a blender; puree until smooth. Divide evenly between prepared glasses, and serve immediately.

ingredients.ingred_name: freshly squeezed lime juice, plus 2 tablespoons for glasses (about 5 limes)
Coco Lopez or cream of coconut

name: Salty Dog
instructions: Spread coarse salt on a small plate. Wet rim of a glass with fresh yellow grapefruit juice; dip rim in salt and add ice to glass. Combine vodka, juice of 1/2 yellow grapefruit, and simple syrup, and pour into glass.

name: Orange Wheat Shandy
instructions: Combine beer, orange juice, and almond extract in a pitcher. Stir; serve with sliced oranges.

ingredients.ingred_name: freshly squeezed orange juice (from 3 to 4 oranges)

name: Lychee Martini
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker halfway with ice. Add in vodka, vermouth, and lychee juice. Shake well. Strain into 2 martini glasses and garnish each with a lychee fruit.

name: Strawberry Margaritas
instructions: Place four 8-ounce glasses in freezer. Place strawberries, tequila, limeade concentrate, and triple sec in the jar of a blender. Blend until all ingredients are thoroughly combined. Add ice and blend until liquid is smooth. Serve immediately in chilled glasses.

name: Pineapple and Mango Rum Cocktails
instructions: Puree mangoes, rum, and  1/2 cup water in a blender. Pour 2 ounces puree into each of six 12-ounce glasses. Fill glasses with ice, and top off with pineapple juice. Garnish with tropical fruit.
ingredients: 2 1/2 small ripe mangoes, peeled and cubed (about 2 cups), plus 1/2 mango cut into slices with skin, for garnish

name: White Cosmopolitan
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add cranberry juice, vodka, and Cointreau. Shake to combine well. Strain into two large martini glasses. Serve immediately.

name: Healthier Pina Colada

name: Lemon Whiskey Sour
instructions: Rub the rim of an old fashioned glass with lemon wedge. Fill a saucer with sugar, and dip the glass, upside down, into the sugar.

Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add whiskey, lemon juice, and 1 teaspoon superfine sugar, and shake until sugar dissolves. Strain into an ice-filled old fashioned glass, and garnish with lemon slice and a cherry.

ingredients.ingred_name: superfine sugar, plus more for rim

name: Sparkling Fruit Coolers
instructions: Freeze the lemonade, limeade, and juice in 3 or 4 ice cube trays.
Fill each of 4 tall glasses to the top with an assortment of ice cubes and add sparkling water to fill. Garnish with limes and serve with iced tea spoons.

ingredients.ingred_name: fruit juice, such as cranberry, orange, apricot, or peach nectar

name: Cranberry Cosmopolitans
instructions: Fill a large pitcher with ice. Pour in all ingredients except cranberries; stir vigorously. Strain into glasses, discarding ice. Garnish with berries.

name: Coconut-Water Vodka Cocktail
instructions: Fill a highball glass with ice. Add vodka and coconut water; stir to combine. Garnish with an orange twist.

name: Citrus Sparkler
instructions: In a large pitcher, whisk together vodka, limoncello liqueur, fresh orange juice, and fresh lemon juice. To serve, divide among 8 ice-filled glasses and top with seltzer. Garnish with lemon zest.

name: Mandarin Cocktail
instructions: Pour liqueur into a champagne flute; top with champagne. Twist clementine peel over glass and gently drop into cocktail.
